data: A lexical resource based on WordNet that assigns sentiment scores (objective, positive, negative) to individual word meanings (synsets).

Contains almost 5000 text fragments collected from financial news and press releases about Finnish companies traded on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange. Each fragment is labeled as positive, negative, or neutral.

A dataset for understanding sentiment in financial texts, combining artificial intelligence and Semantic Web technologies for better recognition, interpretation, and processing of opinions in this context.

Includes entity-sentiment annotation to address the problem of headlines containing multiple entities with potentially conflicting sentiment. This manually annotated dataset, including over 10 700 news headlines, provides insight into sentiment variations depending on specific entities in financial news.

A dataset consisting of tokenized and annotated speeches from the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC), meeting minutes, and press conference transcripts. This resource aims to understand the impact of monetary policy on financial markets through the analysis of the language used by the central bank.

An annotated dataset of relationships in financial documents, containing approximately 29 000 instances and 22 relationship types, covering eight entity pairs (e.g., person-position, organization-money), extracted from SEC 10-X filings. Useful for identifying connections between entities in financial reports.
Compiled from diverse news sources and evaluated by human experts, allowing researchers to study how news headlines influence price movements, asset comparison, and other financial events.
A dataset designed for Named Entity Recognition (NER) in the financial domain, helping to identify and classify financial companies in text data.

Provides a multilingual financial NLP dataset with real financial article headlines in 15 languages. Annotated with high-level and low-level topics, facilitating multi-class and multi-label classification tasks.

A collection of question-answer pairs with in-depth analysis of financial reports. Compiled by financial experts, it focuses on deep logical inference based on financial data, providing training data for answering complex financial queries.
